Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • Field

  • public class Field
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores information on each field (column) in the address book.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int id
      Unique field identifier.
      private java.lang.String name
      Display name of the field.
      private boolean required
      Whether the field can be removed by the user.
      private FieldType type
      Type of field for validation, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Construct a Field not yet associated with any FieldList.
      Field(java.lang.String header)
      Construct a Field using a .pond file header entry.

    • Field Detail

      • type

        private final FieldType type
        Type of field for validation, etc.

      • id

        private int id
        Unique field identifier.

        If set to -1, indicates Entry is not associated with a FieldList.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        Display name of the field.

        Also used for identification in .pond file header.

      • required

        private boolean required
        Whether the field can be removed by the user.

        No effect on FieldList.removeField(int), just UI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field(FieldType t,
     java.lang.String n)
        Construct a Field not yet associated with any FieldList.

        Should be added to FieldList before further use.

        Parameters:
        t - Type of field
        n - Name to call field

      • Field

        public Field(java.lang.String header)
        Construct a Field using a .pond file header entry.
        Parameters:
        header - A String representing this Field
        See Also:
        formatString()

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        int getID()
        Get unique ID of this Field.

        Package visibility as we should mainly be passing around entire Field objects.

        Returns:
        id

      • setID

        void setID(int newID)
        Reset id to new value.

        Use with care as will break association with data in Entry objects.

        Parameters:
        newID - New ID for the Field

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get display name of this Field.
        Returns:
        name

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String n)
        Change the display name of this Field.

        Will probably want to run sanity check to ensure no invalid charactern (eg. tab or null) are displayed.

        Parameters:
        n - The new name for this Field

      • formatString

        public java.lang.String formatString()
        Generates a String suitable for representing this Field in a .pond header.

        Should include FieldType.typeCode and name

        Returns:
        Properly formatted String representation

      • canDelete

        public boolean canDelete()
        Whether the field can be removed by the user.

        No effect on FieldList.removeField(int), just UI.

        Returns:
        required

      • copy

        public Field copy()
        Generate copy of this Field to add to another FieldList.

        Should reset id of copy to -1 to dissassociate from any previous FieldList.

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.String test)
        Test the string for validity given the type of this field.

        Should switch on type for relevant implementation.

        Parameters:
        test - The String to test
        Returns:
        Whether test is valid
